translations.literal: When Xiang Liang crossed the Huai, Xin took up sword and staff to follow him, dwelt under Xi, and was not known anywhere. translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Han king was greatly pleased, considering that he had obtained Xin too late.

sentences.zh: 遂聽信計，部署諸將所擊。

translations.literal: Then listen Xin plan, deploy various generals place strike.
translations.idiomatic: He then followed Xin's plan and deployed the various generals to their attack positions.

translations.literal: Xin completed the enfeoffment rites and sat above. The king said: 'The Chancellor has repeatedly spoken of the General; General, what strategy will you teach me?' Xin thanked him, then asked the king: 'Now facing east to contend for power over the empire—is it not King Xiang?' The Han king said: 'Yes.' Xin said: 'Your Majesty, appraise yourself: in courage, ferocity, benevolence, and strength, who compares with King Xiang?' The Han king was silent for a long time, then said: 'I am not his equal.' Xin bowed twice in congratulations: 'Only I also consider Your Majesty not his equal. Yet I have served him; allow me to speak of King Xiang's character. King Xiang roars with rage and glares, a thousand men all collapse, yet he cannot appoint and employ worthy generals—this is merely the courage of a common man. King Xiang sees people with courtesy and kindness, speaks gently and tenderly; when people are ill, he weeps and shares his food and drink; but when it comes to those who have merit and should be enfeoffed with rank, the seals are worn and broken, he cannot bear to give them—this is what is called womanly benevolence.

sentences.zh: 八月，漢王舉兵東出陳倉，定三秦。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Han wang raise troops east exit Chen Cang, settle three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the Han king raised troops and went east from Chencang, pacifying the three Qin regions.

sentences.zh: 漢二年，出關，收魏、河南，韓、殷王皆降。

translations.literal: Han two year, exit pass, gather Wei, He Nan, Han, Yin wang all surrender.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of Han, he exited the pass and gathered Wei and Henan. The kings of Han and Yin all surrendered.

sentences.zh: 合齊、趙共擊楚。

translations.literal: Combine Qi, Zhao together strike Chu.
translations.idiomatic: He combined with Qi and Zhao to attack Chu together.

sentences.zh: 四月，至彭城，漢兵敗散而還。

translations.literal: Fourth month, arrive Peng Cheng, Han troops defeat scatter return.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, they reached Pengcheng. The Han troops were defeated and scattered, returning home.

sentences.zh: 信復收兵與漢王會滎陽，復擊破楚京、索之閒，以故楚兵卒不能西。

translations.literal: Xin again gather troops with Han wang meet Xing Yang, again strike break Chu Jing, Suo between, because this Chu troops ultimately not able west.
translations.idiomatic: Xin again gathered troops and met the Han king at Xingyang. He again attacked and defeated Chu between Jing and Suo. Because of this, Chu troops ultimately could not advance west.

sentences.zh: 漢之敗卻彭城，塞王欣、翟王翳亡漢降楚，齊、趙亦反漢與楚和。

translations.literal: Han defeat retreat Peng Cheng, Sai wang Xin, Dai wang Yi flee Han surrender Chu, Qi, Zhao also rebel Han with Chu ally.
translations.idiomatic: After Han's defeat and retreat from Pengcheng, King Sai Xin and King Dai Yi fled Han and surrendered to Chu. Qi and Zhao also rebelled against Han and allied with Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月，魏王豹謁歸視親疾，至國，即絕河關反漢，與楚約和。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Wei wang Bao audience return see relative illness, arrive state, then cut off river pass rebel Han, with Chu agreement ally.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, King Wei Bao took leave to return and see his relative's illness. Upon arriving in his state, he immediately cut off the river passes and rebelled against Han, making an alliance agreement with Chu.

sentences.zh: 漢王使酈生說豹，不下。

translations.literal: Han wang send Li Sheng persuade Bao, not descend.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king sent Li Sheng to persuade Bao, but he did not submit.

sentences.zh: 其八月，以信為左丞相，擊魏。

translations.literal: Its eighth month, with Xin as left prime minister, strike Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In that eighth month, Xin was appointed Left Prime Minister and attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏王盛兵蒲阪，塞臨晉，信乃益為疑兵，陳船欲度臨晉，而伏兵從夏陽以木罌缻渡軍，襲安邑。

translations.literal: Wei wang ample troops Pu Ban, block Lin Jin, Xin then moreover make feigned troops, array ships desire cross Lin Jin, but ambush troops from Xia Yang with wood jars pots cross army, attack An Yi.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei amassed troops at Puban and blocked Linjin. Xin then created additional feigned troops, arraying ships as if he wished to cross at Linjin, while his ambush troops crossed the army from Xiayang using wooden jars and pots, attacking Anyi by surprise.

sentences.zh: 魏王豹驚，引兵迎信，信遂虜豹，定魏為河東郡。

translations.literal: Wei wang Bao alarmed, lead troops welcome Xin, Xin then capture Bao, settle Wei as He Dong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: King Wei Bao was alarmed and led troops to meet Xin. Xin then captured Bao and pacified Wei, establishing it as Hedong commandery.

sentences.zh: 漢王遣張耳與信俱，引兵東，北擊趙、代。

translations.literal: Han wang send Zhang Er with Xin together, lead troops east, north strike Zhao, Dai.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king sent Zhang Er together with Xin. They led troops east and north to attack Zhao and Dai.

sentences.zh: 後九月，破代兵，禽夏說閼與。

translations.literal: Later ninth month, defeat Dai troops, capture Xia Yue Yan Yu.
translations.idiomatic: In the following ninth month, he defeated Dai's troops and captured Xia Yue Yanyu.

sentences.zh: 信之下魏破代，漢輒使人收其精兵，詣滎陽以距楚。

translations.literal: Xin subdue Wei defeat Dai, Han always send people gather his elite troops, go Xing Yang to resist Chu.
translations.idiomatic: After Xin subdued Wei and defeated Dai, Han repeatedly sent people to gather his elite troops and send them to Xingyang to resist Chu.

sentences.zh: 信與張耳以兵數萬，欲東下井陘擊趙。

translations.literal: Xin with Zhang Er with troops several ten thousand, wish east descend Jing Xing strike Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Xin together with Zhang Er, with tens of thousands of troops, wished to go east down through Jingxing to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙王、成安君陳餘聞漢且襲之也，聚兵井陘口，號稱二十萬。

translations.literal: Zhao wang, Cheng An jun Chen Yu hear Han about attack them, gather troops Jing Xing mouth, call twenty ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Zhao and Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu heard that Han was about to attack them. They gathered troops at the mouth of Jingxing, claiming twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 廣武君李左車說成安君曰：「聞漢將韓信涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，新喋血閼與，今乃輔以張耳，議欲下趙，此乘勝而去國遠鬬，其鋒不可當。

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun Li Zuo Che persuade Cheng An jun say: Hear Han general Han Xin ford Xi He, capture Wei wang, catch Xia Yue, recently blood flow Yan Yu, now moreover assist with Zhang Er, discuss wish descend Zhao, this ride victory leave country far fight, his point not able resist.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu Li Zuoche persuaded Lord Cheng'an, saying: 'I hear that the Han general Han Xin forded the Xi River, captured the King of Wei, caught Xia Yue, and recently blood flowed at Yanyu. Now he is assisted by Zhang Er and plans to descend upon Zhao. This is riding victory to leave their country and fight far away—their momentum cannot be resisted.

sentences.zh: 臣聞千里餽糧，士有饑色，樵蘇後爨，師不宿飽。

translations.literal: Minister hear thousand li send grain, soldiers have hungry color, gather firewood after cook, army not overnight full.
translations.idiomatic: This minister has heard that when grain is sent from a thousand li away, the soldiers have hungry faces. When firewood is gathered after cooking, the army is not sated overnight.

sentences.zh: 今井陘之道，車不得方軌，騎不得成列，行數百里，其勢糧食必在其後。

translations.literal: Now Jing Xing way, chariots not obtain square track, cavalry not obtain form row, march several hundred li, its situation grain food must in its after.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Jingxing road is such that chariots cannot travel abreast and cavalry cannot form ranks. Marching several hundred li, their supplies must necessarily come after them.

sentences.zh: 願足下假臣奇兵三萬人，從閒道絕其輜重；

translations.literal: Wish your subordinate lend minister surprise troops three ten thousand people, from secluded path cut off their baggage train;
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Lordship would lend me thirty thousand surprise troops to cut off their baggage train by a secluded path.

sentences.zh: 足下深溝高壘，堅營勿與戰。

translations.literal: Your subordinate deep moat high rampart, firm camp not with battle.
translations.idiomatic: Your Lordship should dig deep moats and build high ramparts, fortify the camp and not engage in battle.

sentences.zh: 彼前不得鬬，退不得還，吾奇兵絕其後，使野無所掠，不至十日，而兩將之頭可致於戲下。

translations.literal: They advance not obtain fight, retreat not obtain return, my surprise troops cut off their rear, make fields nothing plunder, not arrive ten days, then two generals heads can deliver to Xi under.
translations.idiomatic: They cannot advance to fight nor retreat to return. My surprise troops will cut off their rear, leaving the fields with nothing to plunder. In not more than ten days, the heads of those two generals can be delivered beneath your tent.

sentences.zh: 願君留意臣之計。

translations.literal: Wish lord pay attention minister plan.
translations.idiomatic: I wish my lord would give heed to this minister's plan.

sentences.zh: 否，必為二子所禽矣。」

translations.literal: No, must for two sons captured.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, you will certainly be captured by those two men.'

sentences.zh: 成安君，儒者也，常稱義兵不用詐謀奇計，曰：「吾聞兵法十則圍之，倍則戰。

translations.literal: Cheng An jun, Confucian, often say righteous troops not use deceit stratagems surprise plans, say: I hear military method ten then surround them, double then battle.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Cheng'an was a Confucian who often said that righteous troops do not use deceitful stratagems or surprise plans. He said: 'I have heard that according to military strategy, if you have ten times their number then surround them; if you have double then fight.

sentences.zh: 今韓信兵號數萬，其實不過數千。

translations.literal: Now Han Xin troops call several ten thousand, reality not exceed several thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Now Han Xin's troops are claimed to be tens of thousands, but in reality they do not exceed several thousand.

sentences.zh: 能千里而襲我，亦已罷極。

translations.literal: Able thousand li attack us, also already tired extreme.
translations.idiomatic: Able to attack us from a thousand li away, they are already exhausted to the extreme.

sentences.zh: 今如此避而不擊，後有大者，何以加之！

translations.literal: Now like this avoid not strike, later have bigger, what with add it!
translations.idiomatic: Now to avoid fighting them like this—if there is someone bigger later, what can be added to this!

sentences.zh: 則諸侯謂吾怯，而輕來伐我。」

translations.literal: Then various marquises call me cowardly, lightly come attack me.'
translations.idiomatic: Then the feudal lords will call me cowardly and lightly come to attack me.'

sentences.zh: 不聽廣武君策，廣武君策不用。

translations.literal: Not listen Guang Wu jun plan, Guang Wu jun plan not use.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen to Lord Guangwu's plan. Lord Guangwu's plan was not used.

sentences.zh: 韓信使人閒視，知其不用，還報，則大喜，乃敢引兵遂下。

translations.literal: Han Xin send people secretly observe, know their not use, return report, then greatly happy, then dare lead troops then descend.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin sent people to secretly observe and learned that they were not using Li Zuoche's plan. He returned and reported this, then was greatly pleased, and dared to lead his troops down.

sentences.zh: 未至井陘口三十里，止舍。

translations.literal: Not arrive Jing Xing mouth thirty li, stop lodge.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty li before reaching the mouth of Jingxing, he stopped and lodged.

sentences.zh: 夜半傳發，選輕騎二千人，人持一赤幟，從閒道萆山而望趙軍，誡曰：「趙見我走，必空壁逐我，若疾入趙壁，拔趙幟，立漢赤幟。」

translations.literal: Night half transmit dispatch, select light cavalry two thousand people, each hold one red banner, from secluded path ascend mountain gaze Zhao army, warn say: Zhao see me flee, must empty rampart pursue me, if quickly enter Zhao rampart, pull Zhao banner, establish Han red banner.
translations.idiomatic: At midnight he transmitted orders and selected two thousand light cavalry, each holding a red banner. From a secluded path they ascended the mountain to watch the Zhao army. He warned them: 'When Zhao sees us flee, they will surely empty their fortifications to pursue us. If you quickly enter Zhao's fortifications, pull down their banners and establish Han's red banners.'

sentences.zh: 令其裨將傳飱，曰：「今日破趙會食！」

translations.literal: Order his deputy general transmit meal, say: Today break Zhao assembly eat!
translations.idiomatic: He ordered his deputy general to transmit meals, saying: 'Today we will break Zhao and assemble to eat!'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆莫信，詳應曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Various generals all not believe, pretend respond say: Yes.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals did not believe him, but pretended to respond: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 謂軍吏曰：「趙已先據便地為壁，且彼未見吾大將旗鼓，未肯擊前行，恐吾至阻險而還。」

translations.literal: Tell army officials say: Zhao already first occupy convenient land as rampart, moreover they not see my great general banner drum, not willing strike forward row, fear I arrive blocked dangerous return.
translations.idiomatic: He told the army officials: 'Zhao has already occupied the convenient terrain to form fortifications. Moreover, they have not seen my great general's banners and drums, so they are unwilling to attack the forward ranks, fearing that I will reach dangerous terrain and return.'

sentences.zh: 信乃使萬人先行，出，背水陳。

translations.literal: Xin then make ten thousand people first go, exit, back water battle formation.
translations.idiomatic: Xin then had ten thousand men go first, exiting to form a battle line with their backs to the water.

sentences.zh: 趙軍望見而大笑。

translations.literal: Zhao army gaze see greatly laugh.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao army saw this and laughed greatly.

sentences.zh: 平旦，信建大將之旗鼓，鼓行出井陘口，趙開壁擊之，大戰良久。

translations.literal: Dawn, Xin erect great general banner drum, drum march exit Jing Xing mouth, Zhao open rampart strike them, great battle long time.
translations.idiomatic: At dawn, Xin erected the great general's banners and drums, marched with drumming out of the Jingxing mouth. Zhao opened their fortifications to attack them, and there was a great battle for a long time.

sentences.zh: 於是信、張耳詳棄鼓旗，走水上軍。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xin, Zhang Er pretend abandon drum banner, flee water upper army.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xin and Zhang Er pretended to abandon their drums and banners, fleeing to the army above the water.

sentences.zh: 水上軍開入之，復疾戰。

translations.literal: Water upper army open enter them, again fierce battle.
translations.idiomatic: The army above the water opened to admit them, and again fought fiercely.

sentences.zh: 趙果空壁爭漢鼓旗，逐韓信、張耳。

translations.literal: Zhao indeed empty rampart contend Han drum banner, pursue Han Xin, Zhang Er.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao indeed emptied their fortifications to contend for Han's drums and banners, pursuing Han Xin and Zhang Er.

sentences.zh: 韓信、張耳已入水上軍，軍皆殊死戰，不可敗。

translations.literal: Han Xin, Zhang Er already enter water upper army, army all fight to death, not able defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin and Zhang Er had already entered the army above the water. The army all fought desperately and could not be defeated.

sentences.zh: 信所出奇兵二千騎，共候趙空壁逐利，則馳入趙壁，皆拔趙旗，立漢赤幟二千。

translations.literal: Xin place exit surprise troops two thousand cavalry, together wait Zhao empty rampart pursue advantage, then gallop enter Zhao rampart, all pull Zhao banner, establish Han red banner two thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Xin's surprise troops of two thousand cavalry waited together for Zhao to empty their fortifications and pursue the advantage, then galloped into Zhao's fortifications, pulled down all Zhao's banners, and established two thousand Han red banners.

sentences.zh: 趙軍已不勝，不能得信等，欲還歸壁，壁皆漢赤幟，而大驚，以為漢皆已得趙王將矣，兵遂亂，遁走，趙將雖斬之，不能禁也。

translations.literal: Zhao army already not win, not able obtain Xin etc., wish return return rampart, rampart all Han red banner, greatly alarmed, think Han all already obtain Zhao wang generals, troops then chaos, flee run, Zhao generals though kill them, not able prohibit.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao army could no longer prevail and could not capture Xin and the others. They wished to return to their fortifications, but saw that all the fortifications had Han red banners. They were greatly alarmed, thinking that Han had already captured all of Zhao's king and generals. The troops then became chaotic and fled. Even though Zhao's generals killed some of them, they could not stop it.

sentences.zh: 於是漢兵夾擊，大破虜趙軍，斬成安君泜水上，禽趙王歇。

translations.literal: Thereupon Han troops flank attack, greatly break capture Zhao army, behead Cheng An jun above Chi water, catch Zhao wang Xie.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Han troops attacked from both flanks, greatly defeating and capturing the Zhao army. They beheaded Lord Cheng'an above the Chi River and captured King Xie of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 信乃令軍中毋殺廣武君，有能生得者購千金。

translations.literal: Xin then order army middle not kill Guang Wu jun, have able alive obtain reward thousand gold.
translations.idiomatic: Xin then ordered the army not to kill Lord Guangwu, offering a thousand pieces of gold for anyone who could capture him alive.

sentences.zh: 於是有縛廣武君而致戲下者，信乃解其縛，東鄉坐，西鄉對，師事之。

translations.literal: Thereupon have bind Guang Wu jun deliver tent under, Xin then loosen his bonds, east face sit, west face answer, teacher serve him.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon someone bound Lord Guangwu and delivered him beneath the tent. Xin then loosened his bonds, sat facing east, had him answer facing west, and served him as a teacher.

sentences.zh: 諸將效首虜，（休）畢賀，因問信曰：「兵法右倍山陵，前左水澤，今者將軍令臣等反背水陳，曰破趙會食，臣等不服。

translations.literal: Various generals present heads captives, finish congratulate, then ask Xin say: Military method right double mountain ridge, front left water marsh, now general command minister etc. instead back water battle formation, say break Zhao assembly eat, minister etc. not convinced.
translations.idiomatic: The various generals presented the heads and captives, finished congratulating him, and then asked Xin: 'Military strategy says to place mountains and hills on the right, water and marshes in front and left. Now the general commanded us to form a battle line with our backs to the water instead, saying we would break Zhao and assemble to eat. We ministers were not convinced.

sentences.zh: 然竟以勝，此何術也？」

translations.literal: However finally with win, this what method?
translations.idiomatic: However, we ultimately won. What method was this?'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「此在兵法，顧諸君不察耳。

translations.literal: Xin say: This in military method, consider various lords not examine.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'This is in the military methods, but you gentlemen did not examine it carefully.

sentences.zh: 兵法不曰『陷之死地而後生，置之亡地而後存』？

translations.literal: Military method not say trap them death land then live, place them perish land then survive?
translations.idiomatic: Doesn't military strategy say: 'Trap them in deadly terrain and they will live; place them in doomed terrain and they will survive'?

sentences.zh: 且信非得素拊循士大夫也，此所謂『驅市人而戰之』，其勢非置之死地，使人人自為戰；

translations.literal: Moreover Xin not obtain accustomed caress follow scholar officials, this called drive market people battle them, its situation not place death land, make each person self for battle;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I did not obtain soldiers who were accustomed to following scholarly officials. This is what is called 'driving marketplace people to battle them.' The situation required placing them in deadly terrain so that each person would fight for himself.

sentences.zh: 今予之生地，皆走，寧尚可得而用之乎！」

translations.literal: Now give them living land, all flee, rather still able obtain use them!'
translations.idiomatic: If I had given them safe terrain now, they would all flee. How could I still obtain and use them!'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆服曰：「善。

translations.literal: Various generals all submit say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals submitted, saying: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 非臣所及也。」

translations.literal: Not minister reach.'
translations.idiomatic: This is beyond what ministers can reach.'

sentences.zh: 於是信問廣武君曰：「仆欲北攻燕，東伐齊，何若而有功？」

translations.literal: Thereupon Xin ask Guang Wu jun say: I wish north attack Yan, east attack Qi, how then have merit?
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xin asked Lord Guangwu: 'I wish to attack Yan to the north and Qi to the east. How can I achieve merit?'

sentences.zh: 廣武君辭謝曰：「臣聞敗軍之將，不可以言勇，亡國之大夫，不可以圖存。

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun decline thank say: Minister hear defeated army general, not can speak courage, perished state official, not can plan survive.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu declined and thanked him, saying: 'I have heard that a general who defeats armies cannot speak of courage; an official of a perished state cannot plan for survival.

sentences.zh: 今臣敗亡之虜，何足以權大事乎！」

translations.literal: Now minister defeated perished captive, what sufficient weigh great matters!'
translations.idiomatic: Now this minister is a captive from a defeated and perished state. How can I be sufficient to weigh great matters!'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「仆聞之，百里奚居虞而虞亡，在秦而秦霸，非愚於虞而智於秦也，用與不用，聽與不聽也。

translations.literal: Xin say: I hear, Bai Li Xi reside Yu Yu perish, in Qin Qin hegemon, not stupid Yu intelligent Qin, use not use, listen not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'I have heard that when Baili Xi resided in Yu, Yu perished; when he was in Qin, Qin became hegemon. It was not that he was stupid in Yu and intelligent in Qin—it was whether he was used or not, listened to or not.

sentences.zh: 誠令成安君聽足下計，若信者亦已為禽矣。

translations.literal: Sincerely make Cheng An jun listen your plan, like Xin also already become captive.
translations.idiomatic: If Lord Cheng'an had sincerely listened to your plan, someone like Xin would also already have been captured.

sentences.zh: 以不用足下，故信得侍耳。」

translations.literal: Because not use you, therefore Xin obtain serve.'
translations.idiomatic: Because they did not use you, therefore Xin was able to serve.'

sentences.zh: 因固問曰：「仆委心歸計，願足下勿辭。」

translations.literal: Then firmly ask say: I entrust heart return plan, wish your honor not decline.
translations.idiomatic: He then firmly asked: 'I entrust my heart and return to your plans. I wish Your Honor not to decline.'

sentences.zh: 廣武君曰：「臣聞智者千慮，必有一失；
愚者千慮，必有一得。
故曰『狂夫之言，聖人擇焉』。
顧恐臣計未必足用，願效愚忠。
夫成安君有百戰百勝之計，一旦而失之，軍敗鄗下，身死泜上。
今將軍涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說閼與，一舉而下井陘，不終朝破趙二十萬眾，誅成安君。
名聞海內，威震天下，農夫莫不輟耕釋耒，褕衣甘食，傾耳以待命者。
若此，將軍之所長也。
然而眾勞卒罷，其實難用。
今將軍欲舉倦獘之兵，頓之燕堅城之下，欲戰恐久力不能拔，情見勢屈，曠日糧竭，而弱燕不服，齊必距境以自彊也。
燕齊相持而不下，則劉項之權未有所分也。
若此者，將軍所短也。
臣愚，竊以為亦過矣。
故善用兵者不以短擊長，而以長擊短。」
韓信曰：「然則何由？」
廣武君對曰：「方今為將軍計，莫如案甲休兵，鎮趙撫其孤，百里之內，牛酒日至，以饗士大夫醳兵，北首燕路，而後遣辯士奉咫尺之書，暴其所長於燕，燕必不敢不聽從。
燕已從，使諠言者東告齊，齊必從風而服，雖有智者，亦不知為齊計矣。
如是，則天下事皆可圖也。
兵固有先聲而後實者，此之謂也。」
韓信曰：「善。」
從其策，發使使燕，燕從風而靡。
乃遣使報漢，因請立張耳為趙王，以鎮撫其國。
漢王許之，乃立張耳為趙王。
楚數使奇兵渡河擊趙，趙王耳、韓信往來救趙，因行定趙城邑，發兵詣漢。
楚方急圍漢王於滎陽，漢王南出，之宛、葉閒，得黥布，走入成皋，楚又復急圍之。
六月，漢王出成皋，東渡河，獨與滕公俱，從張耳軍修武。
至，宿傳舍。
晨自稱漢使，馳入趙壁。
張耳、韓信未起，即其臥內上奪其印符，以麾召諸將，易置之。
信、耳起，乃知漢王來，大驚。
漢王奪兩人軍，即令張耳備守趙地。
拜韓信為相國，收趙兵未發者擊齊。
信引兵東，未渡平原，聞漢王使酈食其已說下齊，韓信欲止。
范陽辯士蒯通說信曰：「將軍受詔擊齊，而漢獨發閒使下齊，寧有詔止將軍乎？
何以得毋行也！
且酈生一士，伏軾掉三寸之舌，下齊七十餘城，將軍將數萬眾，歲餘乃下趙五十餘，為將數歲，反不如一豎儒之功乎？」
於是信然之，從其計，遂渡河。
齊已聽酈生，即留縱酒，罷備漢守御。
信因襲齊歷下軍，遂至臨菑。
齊王田廣以酈生賣己，乃亨之，而走高密，使使之楚請救。
韓信已定臨菑，遂東追廣至高密西。
楚亦使龍且將，號稱二十萬，救齊。
齊王廣、龍且并軍與信戰，未合。
人或說龍且曰：「漢兵遠鬬窮戰，其鋒不可當。
齊、楚自居其地戰，兵易敗散。
不如深壁，令齊王使其信臣招所亡城，亡城聞其王在，楚來救，必反漢。
漢兵二千里客居，齊城皆反之，其勢無所得食，可無戰而降也。」
龍且曰：「吾平生知韓信為人，易與耳。
且夫救齊不戰而降之，吾何功？
今戰而勝之，齊之半可得，何為止！」
遂戰，與信夾濰水陳。
韓信乃夜令人為萬餘囊，滿盛沙，壅水上流，引軍半渡，擊龍且，詳不勝，還走。
龍且果喜曰：「固知信怯也。」
遂追信渡水。
信使人決壅囊，水大至。
龍且軍大半不得渡，即急擊，殺龍且。
龍且水東軍散走，齊王廣亡去。
信遂追北至城陽，皆虜楚卒。
漢四年，遂皆降平齊。
使人言漢王曰：「齊偽詐多變，反覆之國也，南邊楚，不為假王以鎮之，其勢不定。
願為假王便。」
當是時，楚方急圍漢王於滎陽，韓信使者至，發書，漢王大怒，罵曰：「吾困於此，旦暮望若來佐我，乃欲自立為王！」
張良、陳平躡漢王足，因附耳語曰：「漢方不利，寧能禁信之王乎？
不如因而立，善遇之，使自為守。
不然，變生。」
漢王亦悟，因復罵曰：「大丈夫定諸侯，即為真王耳，何以假為！」
乃遣張良往立信為齊王，徵其兵擊楚。
楚已亡龍且，項王恐，使盱眙人武涉往說齊王信曰：「天下共苦秦久矣，相與力擊秦。
秦已破，計功割地，分土而王之，以休士卒。
今漢王復興兵而東，侵人之分，奪人之地，已破三秦，引兵出關，收諸侯之兵以東擊楚，其意非盡吞天下者不休，其不知厭足如是甚也。
且漢王不可必，身居項王掌握中數矣，項王憐而活之，然得脫，輒倍約，復擊項王，其不可親信如此。
今足下雖自以與漢王為厚交，為之盡力用兵，終為之所禽矣。
足下所以得須臾至今者，以項王尚存也。
當今二王之事，權在足下。
足下右投則漢王勝，左投則項王勝。
項王今日亡，則次取足下。
足下與項王有故，何不反漢與楚連和，參分天下王之？
今釋此時，而自必於漢以擊楚，且為智者固若此乎！」
韓信謝曰：「臣事項王，官不過郎中，位不過執戟，言不聽，畫不用，故倍楚而歸漢。
漢王授我上將軍印，予我數萬眾，解衣衣我，推食食我，言聽計用，故吾得以至於此。
夫人深親信我，我倍之不祥，雖死不易。
幸為信謝項王！」
武涉已去，齊人蒯通知天下權在韓信，欲為奇策而感動之，以相人說韓信曰：「仆嘗受相人之術。」
韓信曰：「先生相人何如？」
對曰：「貴賤在於骨法，憂喜在於容色，成敗在於決斷，以此參之，萬不失一。」
韓信曰：「善。
先生相寡人何如？」
對曰：「願少閒。」
信曰：「左右去矣。」
通曰：「相君之面，不過封侯，又危不安。
相君之背，貴乃不可言。」
韓信曰：「何謂也？」
蒯通曰：「天下初發難也，俊雄豪桀建號壹呼，天下之士雲合霧集，魚鱗襍遝，熛至風起。
當此之時，憂在亡秦而已。
今楚漢分爭，使天下無罪之人肝膽涂地，父子暴骸骨於中野，不可勝數。
楚人起彭城，轉鬬逐北，至於滎陽，乘利席卷，威震天下。
然兵困於京、索之閒，迫西山而不能進者，三年於此矣。
漢王將數十萬之眾，距鞏、雒，阻山河之險，一日數戰，無尺寸之功，折北不救，敗滎陽，傷成皋，遂走宛、葉之閒，此所謂智勇俱困者也。
夫銳氣挫於險塞，而糧食竭於內府，百姓罷極怨望，容容無所倚。
以臣料之，其勢非天下之賢聖固不能息天下之禍。
當今兩主之命縣於足下。
足下為漢則漢勝，與楚則楚勝。
臣願披腹心，輸肝膽，效愚計，恐足下不能用也。
誠能聽臣之計，莫若兩利而俱存之，參分天下，鼎足而居，其勢莫敢先動。
夫以足下之賢聖，有甲兵之眾，據彊齊，從燕、趙，出空虛之地而制其後，因民之欲，西鄉為百姓請命，則天下風走而響應矣，孰敢不聽！
邦大弱彊，以立諸侯，諸侯已立，天下服聽而歸德於齊。
案齊之故，有膠、泗之地，懷諸侯以德，深拱揖讓，則天下之君王相率而朝於齊矣。
蓋聞天與弗取，反受其咎；
時至不行，反受其殃。
願足下孰慮之。」
韓信曰：「漢王遇我甚厚，載我以其車，衣我以其衣，食我以其食。
吾聞之，乘人之車者載人之患，衣人之衣者懷人之憂，食人之食者死人之事，吾豈可以鄉利倍義乎！」
蒯生曰：「足下自以為善漢王，欲建萬世之業，臣竊以為誤矣。
始常山王、成安君為布衣時，相與為刎頸之交，後爭張黶、陳澤之事，二人相怨。
常山王背項王，奉項嬰頭而竄，逃歸於漢王。
漢王借兵而東下，殺成安君泜水之南，頭足異處，卒為天下笑。
此二人相與，天下至驩也。
然而卒相禽者，何也？
患生於多欲而人心難測也。
今足下欲行忠信以交於漢王，必不能固於二君之相與也，而事多大於張黶、陳澤。
故臣以為足下必漢王之不危己，亦誤矣。
大夫種、范蠡存亡越，霸句踐，立功成名而身死亡。
野獸已盡而獵狗亨。
夫以交友言之，則不如張耳之與成安君者也；
以忠信言之，則不過大夫種、范蠡之於句踐也。
此二人者，足以觀矣。
願足下深慮之。
且臣聞勇略震主者身危，而功蓋天下者不賞。
臣請言大王功略：足下涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，引兵下井陘，誅成安君，徇趙，脅燕，定齊，南摧楚人之兵二十萬，東殺龍且，西鄉以報，此所謂功無二於天下，而略不世出者也。
今足下戴震主之威，挾不賞之功，歸楚，楚人不信；
歸漢，漢人震恐：足下欲持是安歸乎？
夫勢在人臣之位而有震主之威，名高天下，竊為足下危之。」
韓信謝曰：「先生且休矣，吾將念之。」
後數日，蒯通復說曰：「夫聽者事之候也，計者事之機也，聽過計失而能久安者，鮮矣。
聽不失一二者，不可亂以言；
計不失本末者，不可紛以辭。
夫隨廝養之役者，失萬乘之權；
守儋石之祿者，闕卿相之位。
故知者決之斷也，疑者事之害也，審豪氂之小計，遺天下之大數，智誠知之，決弗敢行者，百事之禍也。
故曰『猛虎之猶豫，不若蜂蠆之致螫；
騏驥之跼躅，不如駑馬之安步；
孟賁之狐疑，不如庸夫之必至也；
雖有舜禹之智，吟而不言，不如瘖聾之指麾也』。
此言貴能行之。
夫功者難成而易敗，時者難得而易失也。
時乎時，不再來。
願足下詳察之。」
韓信猶豫不忍倍漢，又自以為功多，漢終不奪我齊，遂謝蒯通。
蒯通說不聽，已詳狂為巫。
漢王之困固陵，用張良計，召齊王信，遂將兵會垓下。
項羽已破，高祖襲奪齊王軍。
漢五年正月，徙齊王信為楚王，都下邳。
信至國，召所從食漂母，賜千金。
及下鄉南昌亭長，賜百錢，曰：「公，小人也，為德不卒。」
召辱己之少年令出胯下者以為楚中尉。
告諸將相曰：「此壯士也。
方辱我時，我寧不能殺之邪？
殺之無名，故忍而就於此。」
項王亡將鐘離眛家在伊廬，素與信善。
項王死後，亡歸信。
漢王怨眛，聞其在楚，詔楚捕眛。
信初之國，行縣邑，陳兵出入。
漢六年，人有上書告楚王信反。
高帝以陳平計，天子巡狩會諸侯，南方有雲夢，發使告諸侯會陳：「吾將游雲夢。」
實欲襲信，信弗知。
高祖且至楚，信欲發兵反，自度無罪，欲謁上，恐見禽。
人或說信曰：「斬眛謁上，上必喜，無患。」
信見眛計事。
眛曰：「漢所以不擊取楚，以眛在公所。
若欲捕我以自媚於漢，吾今日死，公亦隨手亡矣。」
乃罵信曰：「公非長者！」
卒自剄。
信持其首，謁高祖於陳。
上令武士縛信，載後車。
信曰：「果若人言，『狡兔死，良狗亨；
高鳥盡，良弓藏；
敵國破，謀臣亡。』
天下已定，我固當亨！」
上曰：「人告公反。」
遂械系信。
至雒陽，赦信罪，以為淮陰侯。
信知漢王畏惡其能，常稱病不朝從。
信由此日夜怨望，居常鞅鞅，羞與絳、灌等列。
信嘗過樊將軍噲，噲跪拜送迎，言稱臣，曰：「大王乃肯臨臣！」
信出門，笑曰：「生乃與噲等為伍！」
上常從容與信言諸將能不，各有差。
上問曰：「如我能將幾何？」
信曰：「陛下不過能將十萬。」
上曰：「於君何如？」
曰：「臣多多而益善耳。」
上笑曰：「多多益善，何為為我禽？」
信曰：「陛下不能將兵，而善將將，此乃言之所以為陛下禽也。
且陛下所謂天授，非人力也。」
陳豨拜為鉅鹿守，辭於淮陰侯。
淮陰侯挈其手，辟左右與之步於庭，仰天嘆曰：「子可與言乎？
欲與子有言也。」
豨曰：「唯將軍令之。」
淮陰侯曰：「公之所居，天下精兵處也；
而公，陛下之信幸臣也。
人言公之畔，陛下必不信；
再至，陛下乃疑矣；
三至，必怒而自將。
吾為公從中起，天下可圖也。」
陳豨素知其能也，信之，曰：「謹奉教！」
漢十年，陳豨果反。
上自將而往，信病不從。
陰使人至豨所，曰：「弟舉兵，吾從此助公。」
信乃謀與家臣夜詐詔赦諸官徒奴，欲發以襲呂后、太子。
部署已定，待豨報。
其舍人得罪於信，信囚，欲殺之。
舍人弟上變，告信欲反狀於呂后。
呂后欲召，恐其黨不就，乃與蕭相國謀，詐令人從上所來，言豨已得死，列侯群臣皆賀。
相國紿信曰：「雖疾，彊入賀。」
信入，呂后使武士縛信，斬之長樂鐘室。
信方斬，曰：「吾悔不用蒯通之計，乃為兒女子所詐，豈非天哉！」
遂夷信三族。
高祖已從豨軍來，至，見信死，且喜且憐之，問：「信死亦何言？」
呂后曰：「信言恨不用蒯通計。」
高祖曰：「是齊辯士也。」
乃詔齊捕蒯通。
蒯通至，上曰：「若教淮陰侯反乎？」
對曰：「然，臣固教之。
豎子不用臣之策，故令自夷於此。
如彼豎子用臣之計，陛下安得而夷之乎！」
上怒曰：「亨之。」
通曰：「嗟乎，冤哉亨也！」
上曰：「若教韓信反，何冤？」
對曰：「秦之綱絕而維弛，山東大擾，異姓并起，英俊烏集。
秦失其鹿，天下共逐之，於是高材疾足者先得焉。
蹠之狗吠堯，堯非不仁，狗因吠非其主。
當是時，臣唯獨知韓信，非知陛下也。
且天下銳精持鋒欲為陛下所為者甚眾，顧力不能耳。
又可盡亨之邪？」
高帝曰：「置之。」
乃釋通之罪。
太史公曰：吾如淮陰，淮陰人為余言，韓信雖為布衣時，其志與眾異。
其母死，貧無以葬，然乃行營高敞地，令其旁可置萬家。
余視其母冢，良然。
假令韓信學道謙讓，不伐己功，不矜其能，則庶幾哉，於漢家勳可以比周、召、太公之徒，後世血食矣。
不務出此，而天下已集，乃謀畔逆，夷滅宗族，不亦宜乎！
